definitions.definition: A day on which a festival , religious event, or national celebration is traditionally observed .
A day declared free from work by the state or government .
A period of one or more days taken off work for leisure and often travel ; often plural.
examples: How much holiday are you allowed?

definitions.definition: A period during which pupils do not attend their school ; often plural; rarely used for students at university (usually: vacation ).
examples: I want to take a French course this summer holiday .

definitions.definition: A period during which, by agreement, the usual payments are not made.
A gap in coverage , e.g. of paint on a surface , or sonar imagery .

main_definition: A day on which a festival , religious event, or national celebration is traditionally observed .
secondary_definitions: A day declared free from work by the state or government .
( chiefly UK , Australia ) A period of one or more days taken off work for leisure and often travel ; often plural.
( chiefly UK , Australia ) A period during which pupils do not attend their school ; often plural; rarely used for students at university (usually: vacation ).
( finance ) A period during which, by agreement, the usual payments are not made.
A gap in coverage , e.g. of paint on a surface , or sonar imagery .
